WRITING.TEXT:
I watched the anime up to when they're running through the field with a lady titan chasing them or they're chasing her? It's fuzzy.
Anyway. The entire time I found the writing stilted and very generic "anime". That isn't to say you're wrong for enjoying it of course. But I've been watching anime since I was born and the characters just so often seemed copy and paste. I couldn't get invested when "Generic Anime dude #3" got eaten or was freaking out because he let other people get eaten. I had already seen him in so many other anime that I just couldn't invest. Ya know?
The stoic, emotionally dead characters hardly ever resonate with me, and that was basically their cast.
Take full Metal Alchemist. There's an anime with nuanced characters. Or more recently, One Punch Man. While having those same generic anime tropes, One Punch Man leans into them, mocking them and taking them apart. I love it.
Again. I LOVE attack on Titan's concept. It's animation is top tier, the music is stellar and the voice actors are great. But it's the script that loses me. The thing is, I can see why people would love it, because back in the day. I loved Inuyasha. Which has the same problems and strengths. (Though I'd like to think the Inuyasha characters have slightly more personality, that might just be nostalgia talking though. haha)

WRITING.TITLE: With 2.0 Coming out I would like to share my insights from a few months ago (With some edits) on my favourite map, and one of the most Unique Heroes of the Storm has, Towers of Doom
WRITING.TEXT:
This post originally came about because I was frustrated with people's attitudes towards the Boss on Towers of Doom. It is a momentum sink and can actually lose you a game that you've been leading.
Basically, if you wipe the team and it's a question of taking lanes or taking boss? **You always take the lanes.** Because the lanes will give you more damage on your towers. (Boss does four, but 3 extra lanes + 3 towers = 9.)
Even having two extra towers and taking two shrines **you get more value**.
BUT it also sets your enemy back. They cannot safely run up that lane now to escape you, they need to take those forts back to be able to do damage with the objective again, and while they're taking one back you can take another. Taking just**one fort removes 1/4th of their damage.**
Let your split pusher split push while you defend a tower. **Just poke the enemy, don't engage. Keep them from getting that shrine as long as you can.** Build that momentum. Then when the enemy has four points left, take the boss for the win.
But there is **almost** no instance where taking boss is better than taking a fort.
Azmodan, Gazlowe, Slyvanas, Zagara, Hammer, Xul, Murky, Abathur and The Lost Vikings thank you for your time. Pushing really does win games on Towers of Doom.
Also. I would like to add too this that your core health is a resource on this map. As long as you have 1 health, and your enemies have 0 you win. Do the math. Are you able to sacrifice a few early objectives to get yourself a siege lead? If so, it may be worth it.
Also, if you help someone take a merc camp, don't leave that lane. Walk the mercenaries in to the buildings. Only leave the lane if you're using the Mercs as a decoy to pressure another lane, but fill your allies in on what you're doing. The mercs are fragile and only get value from either hitting your opponents buildings, or crossing their no mans land and dealing direct core damage.

Yeah. Purely fan art. Those two characters are basically dead inside.
It's a horror story of sorts, set in a kind of feudal steampunk Japan setting. It's a hugely UNIQUE concept just not incredibly well done.

Attack on Titan fan art.
It's not cute at all. Very gory. Was super popular for awhile.
I found it was kinda poorly written.

Yeah. You've got to consider all of his abilities and qualities.
His W, will wander off if it doesn't detect an enemy, his laser has a small engagement range but he can chase with it and it can be talented to grow.
His health pool is as enormous as he is, boasting one of the highest health pools in the game, under Cho'Gal, Full Soul Diablo, and Avatar Muradin.
His W is there to deal some damage, block skill shots and disrupt channels. He is there to block skill shots that are heading into the back line, and provide a body to watch the back of his tank/bruisers.

Level 20 Azmo here, there Azmodan wasn't so much on point with his timings as using the globes on cooldown. Luckily he had his minion's spawnign from it to provide a second layer of poke. But he is the one who lost them the game.
Look at that team fight at the start of the video, he's barely in it at all, his health stays pristine until his team starts to fall.
Azmo is a mid line character. He's big with a big HP pool and autos that hurt a bunch, plus his Laser. He should always be between the front line and back line, but he was way back line where his HP pool, his autos and his lasers weren't worth anything.

Most often Bottom is the solo lane, most of the time because of saftey, the rest of the time out of habit.
There are some maps you'll see top lane solo, but really the maps are super balanced so it doesn't matter too much.
Those are rare and far between and someone looking for Abathur tips will not be able to recognize them.

Also, Bushes aren't the only place to hide. Often there are curving walls and what not you and hide behind, feel free to either spread your mines out for scouting info if you keep an eye on a mini map, or fill your hidey hole and the area leading too it with them so someone coming to gank you get's surprised
Also. Monstrosity is terrible compared to ultimate evolution. Your locus will push just fine and you'll be more valuable in team fights. Especially with heroes like Jaina, her trait will combo with clone jaina.

WRITING.TITLE: Optimum Order for maximizing 2.0 unlocks
WRITING.TEXT:
First, grab yourself which ever mega bundle you so desire. Ideally the one with the most heroes, but it's up too you. Because even if you get a hero out of one of your boxes, you wont get shards for getting the mega pack. But if you get the mega pack, you'll get some of those dirty filthy shards that you're going to need to get the things you actually want.
Second, crack open those sweet sweet legendary veteran packs if you have any, then re roll as often as you feel you need too. You are garunteed to get one legendary in these. By doing them first, you have all your gold and can re roll as many times as you want.
If you get a legend that you sort of want, but want to reroll for something you REALLY REALLY WANT? Don't. You wont get the thing you want. Take the thing you sorta want.
Then, from there. Figure out how much gold you have in relation to epic chests for rerolls.
250 x number of chests = amount of chests you can re roll once. Do you have more gold left over?
500 x number of chests = amount of gold you need to reroll twice once you add this number too your first number.
And if you still have more gold,
750 x the number of chests add it to the other two numbers, do you have enough gold to reroll everything three times? Groovy.
If you don't have enough to reroll three times, just don' reroll many, if any three times. Since the price is so high, just re roll cheaply. You'll want to have some gold for future rare/epic chests. Don't be tempted to reroll on commons. They're a gold sink so you cannot buy new heroes as they're released. Don't let common boxes trap you. (Unless you're like MFPallytime and have all the gold the game has ever generated. )
Then your common chests. Don't open them. Ever. Ignore them. They're not worth your time. They're a dissapointment to their parents and all who have loved them and come before them. Look on them with pity and shame.
Then open them anyway and someone get eight legendaries out of two of them, then post on reddit for some sweet Karma.
And that's how you maximize your 2.0 launch experience.
It is all Cho
That's a gameplay reward for everymode just like gold for winning is.
Playing the game?

Nah. Common's give like, five shards I think? One rare duplicate gives 20. So /u/madmax569 did the math and it turns out that you're doubling your chance to get rare's in all of the boxes with one reroll. As opposed to a 39% chance or something like that with the extra box.
One rare duplicate is worth the same as 4 common duplicates.
/u/madmax569 did the math on it in a comment lower down. Check it out. :)
Because that's not relevant to the conversation at hand? Brawls should have been giving XP from the start in most people's opinions.
Yeah, I figured that would be the actual value, double that is too say. But I wasn't sure of the math. :)

You can't, because it's random.
But you can compare the average value of one extra loot box, vs four re rolls.
The four re rolls win everytime.

WRITING.TITLE: The new Brawl reward is worth less than 1/5 the old one.
WRITING.TEXT:
Here's a hypothetical. You've got 0 gold, and four Loot boxes. You play the Brawl and get a Fifth loot box. Neat!
Or, you have four loot boxes, and you then get 1000 gold. You can use that 1000 gold to re roll each of those four loot boxes once, so your chances of getting something good, rather than increasing by 1/5th with the extra loot box, is increased by x2!
I'm sure someone else can do the math here, I think it comes out to being 1/10th the value? Although you do get 4 extra items you wouldn't get before. Gold is, in the end more flexible because you can also get heroes with it.
This new loot box reward is not the way to go for people who want to play F2P.

Oh man. TLV are amazing on this map. One player can rush a payload to the otherside on their own, or they can split push/soak with two, guide a payload on their own and enable their team to kick ass.
They can grab three items, dropping turrets and heals left and right.
You'll see TLV grouped up more often than usual on this map, that's for sure. But at the same time, it's because they're hitting camps, ganking someone solo (With how small the map is, it's super easy for TLV to gank finally. Very few heroes can handle all three vikings. Very few people realize this though, which makes ganking so easy.) pushing carts, scouting vision, taking out a fort. Etc etc etc. It's so cool.

WRITING.TITLE: This new "Exodia" mage meta is unacceptable
WRITING.TEXT:
So, I've run across maybe MAYBE 3 or 4 OTKO decks over my years of playing. Paladin Murloc dealy bopper and that Purple genie guy build.
I also know, that there have been more styles.
BUT I have seen this mage thing four times TODAY. I won against it once, and lost twice. Losing against it is not fun. At all. Everytime I play, I out play them keep their board clear keep mine healthy etc. I was at 30 life. Then in ONE TURN (Two, I suppose because of the quest card) the wipe me out. Nothing on the board for me to counter, no way for me to defend against it. Nothing. It just feels awful to play against.
And apparently people are getting ripped off with duplicates? What's all that about? (I myself got the "Discover a Murloc" murloc in about 15/25 boosters. But I didn't really think much of it at the time.)
I can't watch the video. What is Project Scorpio? A new game console?

Hey guys. My laptop has finally aged out (As in I can no longer play modern games like this one) and I cannot afford a new computer. But it still makes me happy to see the community pushing on. As a poor gamer, piracy has been the only way I could ever really continue my hobby.
I just wanted to give a shout out.
go for the vetran chest. I need 35 levels and I'm going for it. Much better value. One extra item and it's legendary guaranteed.

Another fun thing to do, is not grab Metamorph. Instead grab the hunt and pick off anyone dumb enough to solo lane. There are very few characters that can Take Illidan 1v1 and quite often he can get a kill and escape during a 2v1. (Though, going after someone like Kael when they have ETC with them is just dumb. Pick your battles.)
But yeah. I love both Sonya and Illidan, and I choose Illidan if I want more kills, I choose Sonya if I want more damage.
Think of it like this, Sonya is way better at setting kills up for people like Valla, Lunara, Kael etc. Illidan is better at sealing the deal after an enemy has been poked down enough.
He's also awesome at supporting out of position allies iwith "the hunt"
Oh what's that? Zeratul is harassing my out of position support? "You are not prepared" and Illidan is one of the few people who can chase zeratul down after he blinks away.
Right?
I wouldn't be able to run a 10v10. :(

This is very exciting. I'm very happy what Blizzard has done in regards too their veteran players. One thing I'm concerned with is the gambling nature of this whole thing. I get that it makes money, but I'm uncomfortable with the loot box system in general. Many players have already discussed the perils of gambling addiction in their own lives and the lives of family.
My question is, how frequently will be be able to buy the skins we want? To reduce the need to gamble for them?
Obviously this is not the Q A before someone climbs up my arse. But I might not be here for it, and if someone wants to post this question that would be great. I've got two more questions that are more personal I'll post below here, but they aren't as important.
The Lost Vikings... Where's the love? Are there ANY skins in the works? Even just extra colour tints? Getting an ETA on it would be great, but I'd honestly just really like to know if something at all is coming our way. I love those guys. Their games helped me learn to read when I was young! They've got a special place in my heart.
And another quesiton, each other modern Blizzard game, Hearthstone, World of Warcraft, and Diablo III all have Heroes of the Storm mounts you can gain by progressing in game. I was wondering if Starcraft or Overwatch would ever get something like that? (I understand an Overwatch Mount might be tricky since we're obviously never shown anything, but something silly like a Unicycle with a junkrat wheel would be awesome. You can use the Treasure Goblin mount stature for it.)
So yeah. Neither of these two questions are important. But I think the first one is. If someone could be swell enough to ask these questions for me in the Q A that would be very nice.
Oh nice. Yeah thats the kinda idea

Find heroes with a common theme but have different qualities.
Illidan, Diablo and Kharazim are all similar in positioning, but different in use.
Learn how to use them, then learn how to use others like them.
Illidan can help you learn greymane who can help you learn other ranged heroes.
Diablo can help you learn etc or even rexxar.
Kharazim will teach you when you need to use your heals and on whom, which translates into other supports.
Of course, thats just what worked for me.
Honestly, if you like playing the PTR at all I'd suggest it. It'll give you a head start building stuff up. It's a good way to test to see if you'd do better on a Smurf account as well.
